title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: meet with director and board, talk about previous lab experience and teaching assistant roles. explain undergraduate degree and experience. if any publications, mention those. take a tour of the lab and meet staff.
Interview Questions: what did you study in undergrad

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: Screening call was the first step to ensure you are aware of the job description, from there it a virtual panel interview. Final step was onsite, committee and half day interview process.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest benefit to this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful, straightforward. Met with all faculty, Dean, students. Well organized, professional, and courteous. Really enjoyed the entire process. Both virtual and in person, very flexible and respectful. I was very impressed.
Interview Questions: How do you view collaboration?

title: Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was friendly, he introduced himself and started by asking me to introduce myself, from there, we started a series of questioning, asking me to explain my skills,stating my intended contribution to the department and my view of working with people from  different culture
Interview Questions: What skills am I bringing to the department if I was offered the job?

title: Student Helper Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and simple, super nice and polite but also very direct when needed. Would work there again if complications due to covid didn't arise at the time. Awesome staff and incredibly helpful.
Interview Questions:
This Job deals with highly sensitive student information, are you okay with working with that? 
Do you have experience in keeping sensitive information such as student IDs and such?

title: Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two managers which described the role and asked about my background in the field. There were a few security questions based in material covered in Security+ certification.
Interview Questions:
What is the CIA triad?
What is an APT?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very interactive and engaging, they ask very open-ended and situational based questions to gauge how you would handle common situations and evaluate your ability to manage under duress. Depending on the position you are interviewing for there will be a different supervisor, but an HR rep will always be part of the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your take on accountability and how does that intertwine with leadership capability?

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: They called me for an interview and they had me come in with the lead and boss of the job. Then they asked me a series of questions for the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you handle a hostile situation?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview followed by an all-day on-campus interview with various committees. Interesting thing is that one of the people interviewing me on one panel got the job - seems rather unethical.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard mix of past experience and behavioral.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well. I did not find it difficult. The staff id very sweet. It was a decent interview. Nothing very specific. Just details about the jobs previoulsy worked on and refernce check and general questions
Interview Questions: How do u handle difficult calls

title: Student Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was quite informative and enjoyable. The entire process went like a chit chat where we talked about cybersecurity and the world now. A few questions on the importance of the core objectives of cybersecurity and how you think you are achieving it through your posture.
Interview Questions: What kinds of steps are you taking to currently improve your security posture?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. In the first round, you rotate from seat to seat answering a few questions from each interviewer, approximately 8ish in total. If selected, the second round was with 2 or 3 RHD's in a more detailed interview lasting approx 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on making residents feel included as part of the hall?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a Casual and relaxing environment. Hiring staff we’re friendly and straight forward. I was very pleased with the interview process overall. I felt like welcomed and was aware of the job expectations once the interview was over
Interview Questions: What is your past experience

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview includes an interview day. I went through 4-6 interviews in one day (with the other candidates). The interviews were only about a half hour long.  The whole process was called “visit days” where you met faculty, staff and other students, toured campus, and interviewed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: One brief interview, and it was no very structured. This is much different than the full time interviews, as expected. Interview was easy and did not take very long since they already knew me.
Interview Questions: Why do you deserve to be a student manager?

title: Analyst (Football) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was applying for an analyst role with the football team. Interview process was very conversational with the coaching staff over the phone. Basically, just asked about my football knowledge, education and background.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in football?

title: Adjunct Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and set up a phone interview with two people in the department. I was contacted about a week later to learn that I had been selected for the role.
Interview Questions: What teaching methods would you use?

title: Athletic Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Livonia, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Included sending an email to the appropriate department's supervisor stating interest, or apply through the employee board online.  Sending in a resume, and then setting up an interview time!
Interview Questions: What was it that lead you to apply to be an athletic academic tutor?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application, not really an interview process. Needed references and a resume but once I was selected they placed me in the position. I met with my future boss and she described some of the things I would be doing and asked about my experiences to see if we were a good fit.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with graphic design?

title: Technology Operations - Student Web and App Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of asking you to discuss the skills listed on your resume, what interests you in technology, about your other interests and extracurriculars/projects, and questions about where you would like to see your career going in the future. At the end you where asked to write code for a basic problem.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to see yourself in ten years?

title: Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy Process. Will review your resume and will ask questions according to that. The interviewer will be from technical department and will expect you to know all the basic things about technical support
Interview Questions: Object Oriented Programming in Visual Basic ?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Go to positional processing where Hall Directors in different areas interview you for a 5 minute period then you rotate. Get selected to a final interview in different areas of campus.
Interview Questions: How are you going to create an inclusive environment for our residents?

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: talked to my adviser and had to go to the hiring office, really easy and quick. just had to walk to the hiring office across campus submit paper work and bring it back to my boss
Interview Questions: there were no questions asked other than do you want to be a lab aide

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got back with me quickly to set up an interview and planned well around my schedule. Questions were very basic and covered my previous similar experience to the job I would be working as well as any other skills I had related to the job. They were very enthusiastic and descriptive about what I would be doing, describing my responsibilities as well as any other types of projects I would…
Interview Questions: Why did you come back to school?

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call to set up a date for interview. It was very smooth, I actually called to reschedule due to school work. Interview day was straightforward. Four interviewers and me in a room. I was given a task to code up an algorithm for and hand over after the interview
Interview Questions: Basic questions about programming languages I was familiar with; attitude to work and how I handle working with others; how I would handle work related issues especially emotionally related issues

title: Senior Specialist Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the online job posting. In 2 weeks, I received a phone call to schedule an in-person interview. The interview consisted of 3 people asking me questions, all pretty typical questions. Then I received a call a week later offering the job.
Interview Questions: What would your former employer say is a task/skill you could improve upon.

title: OIT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Manager contacted me over the phone then set up an interview in person. Sat in a rear conference room with two managers and they asked the questions on their interview packet. They asked some technical questions but were interested in customer service as well. The questions were not hard and they were genuine during the interview. You could even say candid.
Interview Questions: Explaining the basic components of a computer.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is not difficult.  The main focus is for them to get to know your personality and see if you would fit in with their staff.  They will ask a couple situation based questions, but nothing to scary. Good Luck!
Interview Questions: What is a challenge that you have faced in the based, and how did you attack it?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very simple and straight forward. They mostly wanted to know my educational background and skillset that would be useful for the position. Very friendly interview, not high pressure at all.
Interview Questions: How well do you see yourself accomplishing the assigned tasks.

title: TechOps Expert Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: It took about 1 and half hour. I had to take an appointment initially and send the resume to the Main officer and then get the appointment scheduled later. I went to the Office and the interview went on for an hour and half and the officer was very friendly.
Interview Questions: What is the difference between the RAM and ROM

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a little too relaxed and sometimes too causal for the role. Easy to predict questions and responses.  Would have liked more details about role. The panel was helpful but not diverse.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style?

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very long, about six months from the closing date of the job post. Following the interview with the specific department, the process was much quicker as well the rest of the paperwork. The process is probably very different among the various departments at the university. Mine consisted of three people and the interview involved questions and answers from the panel followed by a written test (of intelligence and character). The entire process took less than two hours.
Interview Questions:
What makes you the best candidate for this job?
Tell me about your family.
What are your weaknesses for this position?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Central Michigan University
Interview Descriptions: One interview with many behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where you had to solve a problem without knowing what to do or having someone to ask?

title: Ad Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and fun. I interviewed with the head designer and we talked about my portfolio. She was very kind and clearly enjoyed her job. It took me a few months to get in because they were full on designers, but once I did I loved it! It's a great place to work.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: short interview, one round face to face. very laid back interview process only took about 30 minutes. felt more like a conversation than an interview. made me feel very comfortable with the environment and the hiring manager
Interview Questions: what are your strengths?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really an interview process, it was more or less hand in a resume and have small talk for a few minutes just to see my initial personality.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got back with me quickly to set up an interview and planned well around my schedule. Questions were very basic and covered my previous similar experience to the job I would be working as well as any other skills I had related to the job. They were very enthusiastic and descriptive about what I would be doing, describing my responsibilities as well as any other types of projects I would need to complete.
Interview Questions: Why I left my previous employer.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Central Michigan University in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took longer than expected, there was a phone interview before an actual interview.  The whole process from applying for the job to the actual interview took almost two months.  Once I made it to campus for a face to face interview- the process again was tedious- I had to interview with 3 different people and had to answer the same questions with each person.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard questions about work history and how I would handle certain situations.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Athens, OH) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone call. The interviewer asked me to say about my background. Then he asked me if I could be ready for the job within a couple of month.
Interview Questions: How early can I be ready for the job?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Just an explanation of job, who does what, what skills are needed. Asked what my major was, what my expertise was what my interests were. He showed me what the final product looked like, where I could work, how we would stay in touch.
Interview Questions: Are you good with computers?

title: English Language Institute Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
It took approximately four weeks from application to interview notification, plus two weeks for interview. In the email, they set one time that I was allotted to interview rather than a range of possible times.

Phone interview was a standard academic screening interview. They asked five or six standard questions about teaching English as a Second Language. The program seemed stolid and stagnant; they didn't seem interested in very much beyond standard reading, writing, listening, and speaking classes. The committee seemed somewhat...bored. Then, they notified me that I should hear back from them fairly soon. About 5 weeks later, I followed up, and they replied with a polite, apologetic email that another candidate had been offered the position, thus the secrecy.
Interview Questions: How do you approach teaching? What is your teaching style?

title: Building Maintenance Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was incredibly easy. Seeing as it was a seasonal position, they really just want to know if you're willing to actually work. The interview itself is super informal. Typically, the supervisor will meet with you when they have a spare minute and ask you what kind of experience you have working in maintenance. This is mostly to get an idea of where they can put you on the summer staff. Meanwhile, they'll be trying to get an idea of what your personality is like and if you'll be committed to getting to work on time.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of applying online, sending resume, initail phone screen and then on campus interview.  The campus interview was an all day interview, including meals, where you meet each department member individually.  The highlight was that you have to teach a class in front of students and faculty members that will vote on you
Interview Questions: Teaching Philosophy

title: BMW Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: apply in person and then be selected for an interview. must be a student at cmu to be able to apply. many are able to get the job the same day that they apply
Interview Questions: What my past experiences were with maintenance

title: IT Helpdesk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They asked questions about basic Windows and OSX troubleshooting along with typical interview questions. Overall a laid back and easy interview, if you have ever done an interview before then you will be fine. There are no trick questions or anything out of the ordinary. Best of luck to all interviewees!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Temp Mechanical Trades Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Saint Charles, MI) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: quick , basiscally over the phone, then  some paper work and a physical by CMU,  no cost to you.
Interview Questions: questions where simple and basic, nothing tricky about any of them.

title: Professor of Dance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process was somewhat confusing.  The school had asked me for additional information because I was one of three candidates chosen for the position.  Weeks later the position was on hold because the committee with administrators could not agree on the status of the full-time position.  In August, 2010, they called to interview me on the telephone because the position was re-instituted  and I was chosen.

My perceptions of my fellow colleagues was honorable and respectful, as I was respectful to all. Unfortunately the upper administrators were not considerate for changes for the departments needs and future visions and positive implementations.  Senior faculty were not supportive of new faculty and intimidation was their weapon to make several colleagues to either leave their positions in the college or constantly reporting negative comments of unhappiness to upper administrators. Protocols were disregarded unfortunately.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about being hired without tenure security but encouraging?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Central Michigan University (Mount Pleasant, MI) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the acting department chair for a phone interview and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Would you be willing to teach four courses a semester for $11,000?
